title: Mechanical Vibration and Natural Modes: Activity-Based Project Learning Using the Kalimba

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Vibration Theory, Foundational MATLAB Programming, and Intermediate Engineering Mathematics
context.additional_context: Conducted in a graduate-level environment with digital devices (laptops, sensor kits), emphasizing theory-practice integration through a three-stage (theory-simulation-experiment) learning process

learning_goals: The unique vibrational frequency of a kalimba tine can be calculated and analyzed by applying cantilever beam theory.
Performing vibration mode simulations of a kalimba under real-world conditions using finite element method (FEM) software (e.g., ANSYS).
Acquiring and interpreting experimental data from a physical kalimba using a MATLAB-based spectrum analyzer.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
